meanings.definition: A level of quality or rank
meanings.sent1: The toy car's quality was of the highest grades.
meanings.sent2: She received top grades for her excellent performance.
meanings.sent3: The cake's deliciousness was of such high grades that it disappeared in minutes.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft reached grades that surpassed all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with vibrant colors of different grades.

meanings.definition: A mark or rating given to a student's work
meanings.sent1: The student proudly displayed her good grades on the fridge.
meanings.sent2: His grades in math improved after extra study sessions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's grades for catching mice were not impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her grades in art class were a reflection of her creativity.
meanings.sent5: The grades on the test paper revealed his hard work and dedication.

meanings.sent1: The road had a steep grades that made it hard to climb.
meanings.sent2: The skiers enjoyed the gentle grades of the beginner slope.
meanings.sent3: The grades of the hill made it a challenging hike.
meanings.sent4: The grades of the mountain were daunting but rewarding to conquer.
meanings.sent5: The grades of the slide made it thrilling for the children.

meanings.definition: A degree of inclination or decline
meanings.sent1: The ship had to navigate the varying grades of the river.
meanings.sent2: The graph showed the different grades of temperature change.
meanings.sent3: The grades of the rollercoaster made her stomach drop.
meanings.sent4: The grades of the path made it difficult to walk uphill.
meanings.sent5: The grades of the hillside created a beautiful landscape.
